title.narrative: Secondment of Steen Nørlov – Head of the Council of Europe Office, Kyiv, Ukraine

description.narrative:
As a supplement to our traditional contributions, based on partnerships with our Eastern partner countries, a limited part of the budget for the Neighbourhood programme, is allocated to secondments. This allows experts to be posted to international organisations and missions conducting activities relevant for the aims and goals set in the Neighbourhood programme - in this case the Council of Europe.
The Council of Europe in Ukraine The Council of Europe Office in Ukraine facilitates the implementation of the Council of Europe's mission in the country on human rights protection, democracy support and the rule of law, and coordinates and implements cooperation projects and programs. Many projects are assigned Council of Europe, such as, protecting social rights across the country, promoting equal opportunities for vulnerable groups etc.
Objectives/activities Responsibilities of the Head of the Council of Europe Office, Kyiv includes: - facilitating the identification of needs for capacity-building and co-ordinating activities in the country with other international organisations and institutions, as well as other international and local partners active in the country; - providing advice, support and overall in situ co-ordination with national authorities in planning, negotiation and timely implementation of targeted Council of Europe co-operation projects; - managing the Office.
